resources.string: Details of car will be fetched from history.
If you want to view history. Click Here
Health Score of your car is:
Enter the details for the \nfollowing things changed/serviced
Here you can check the\nmaintenance history \nof your car
Mileage at which engine oil was changed/serviced
Dear User, according to our calculation the problem you are facing is:
-Due to the depletion of water in the radiator, your engine is running hot, which is causing this problem
Would you like to implemenent a solution?

The battery light indicates a battery charging problem. If the battery light comes on and stays on while you are driving, the most common cause is a broken alternator belt. Total failure of the alternator is another possibility. But you want to get to the garage before the battery fails and your car dies.

The Speedometer provides in detail guide of fuel dial, speed dial, accelerator dial, current gear, car reading and heat dial.
- Fuel Dial: It shows the level of fuel in car with E as empty and F as Full.
- Speed Dial: It shows current speed of the car.
- Accerelator Dial: It shows current rpm of car, the force with which accelerator is pressed.
- Current Gear: It shows in which gear your car is in but in case of Automatic transmission only.
- Car Reading: It shows the KMs driven by the car.
- Heat Dial: It shows the current temperature of car. H as Hot and C as Cool.
The hand brake light stays on when hand brake is pulled up. Driver need to pull hand brake down, otherwise car would not be able to move.

The engine check light indicates a warning to check engine. Check engine lights come in orange, yellow or amber, depending on the manufacturer. If the light begins flashing, however, it indicates a more serious problem, such as a misfire that can quickly overheat the catalytic converter. These emissions devices operate at high temperatures to cut emissions but can pose a fire hazard if faulty.

If your oil light comes on while you are driving, it means there has been a drop in the oil pressure in your engine. Your engine requires a steady supply of oil to keep all of its moving parts lubricated, so it is important not to let the vehicle run for long with insufficient oil pressure.

Front guide includes:
- Front grill: It is used to get radiator steam to flow out of engine bay. It also includes logo.
- Headlights: These are used for light at night. Controlled from inside the car. It also includes indicator for right and left turn. 
- Fog lights: These are useful in foggy weather for better vision.

Back guide includes:
- Labels: These include: Name, Logo, Variant, Prosmatic (For automatic transmission).
- Backlights: These are used for light for car behind your car. It includes Brake light, Indicator light and Reverse gear light. Brake light is dim on Headlights and Parking lights and gets bright for brake.
- Key hole: It is used to open trunk of the car with the help of key.

Side guide includes:
- Door handles: Used to open door of car from outside. Door includes child lock feature for childern safety. It limits door control to outside handle only.
- Fuel Tank Cap: It is usually on left side of right hand drive cars, which is controlled from inside the car. Refueling is done through here.
- Side Indicators: Side indicators are located on front fender usually or on side mirrors. Used for side by car to get to know that you are going to turn.
- Side Mirrors: These are used to look for traffic on each side of road.

As your car is running but it is heating up. And according to you, there is a steam from Radaitor. Here are some tips before doing any action:
1- Radiator must be hot and pressurized so do not open it until it cools down. 
2- Check engine coolant bottle fluid and if it is below level, fill it first.
3- For quick cool down of radiator throw some water over it.

As your car is not starting up but car is picking self, which means self is working fine. The problem seems to be in battery. Here are few things which you need to check when you open the app:
1- Terminals of battery are connected properly and tightly or not.
2- If Battery fluid level is below the mark, then you can add water. 
3- If none of this works and your car has manual transmission then try for push start(Put your car in 2nd gear with clutch pressed, " after some speed release clutch suddenly and press accelarator.)
4- For Automatic transmission and in case of push start failure, connect your car battery to any charged battery through wires(Remember: Positive for postive terminal and negative for negative.)

"As your car is running but it is heating up. And according to you, there is a steam from Engine Head. Which means your car might be running short of oil, this can be caused by the leakage from the bottom of Engine. You can also check oil level on Engine oil guage(Oil Dipstick) by pulling it out.
"As your car is staring for a second and then turning off and fuel guage is on \"E\". Which means car has no fuel in it. Please reach nearby petrol pump for refill."

"As your car is staring for a second and then turning off and fuel guage is on not on \"E\". Which means car is either facing issue with fuel pump(fuel injection) or youe fuel needle is not working properly. Please contact nearby mechanic.
"As your car is staring for a second and then turning off. Which means either car has no fuel in it or fuel injection is issue. Please reach nearby petrol pump for refill or contact mechanic.

"As your car is running and not heating up but running with jerks. Which means car is doing missing, reasons can be:\n1- Some fuse(s) not working properly, needs to be changed.\n2- Some electric wires might be short.

"As your car is not facing problem in any of the below mentioned problem. So this is not a basic problem: 
1- Battery
2- Engine head heating
3- Radiator Heating
4- Missing
5- Fuel problem
A headlamp is a lamp attached to the front of a vehicle to illuminate the road ahead. Headlamps are also often called headlights.
The hood or bonnet is the hinged cover over the engine of motor vehicles that allows access to the engine compartment.

A side-view mirror, often called side mirror, is a mirror placed on the exterior of motor vehicles for the purposes of helping the driver see areas behind and to the sides of the vehicle, outside the driver peripheral vision.
The windshield or windscreen of a car is the front window, which provides visibility while protecting occupants from the elements.

Alloy wheels are wheels that are made from an alloy of aluminium or magnesium. Alloys are mixtures of a metal and other elements. They generally provide greater strength over pure metals, which are usually much softer and more ductile.

A tire or tyre is a ring-shaped component that surrounds a wheel rim to transfer a vehicle load from the axle through the wheel to the ground and to provide traction on the surface over which the wheel travels.
A car door is a type of door, typically hinged, but sometimes attached by other mechanisms such as tracks, in front of an opening which is used for entering and exiting a vehicle.

A door handle or door knob is a mechanism used to open or close a door. Car door handles may protrude from the vehicle exterior surface or be streamlined into the vehicle contour. In some automobiles, especially luxury vehicles.
The fuel door of the car allows the user to gain access to the fuel cap, which has to be removed in order to refuel the car.
Tail lights serve the purpose of indicating the drivers behind about the status of the car, if the car is breaking, if it is reversing or if its turning.
The trunk, boot of a car is the vehicle main storage or cargo compartment.
The antenna on your car is built to pick up the magnetic energy of the radio waves and send it to the car radio receiver, which in turn isolates and amplifies the radio waves you want to listen to.

A steering wheel is a type of steering control in vehicles.Steering wheels are used in most modern land vehicles, including all mass-production automobiles, as well as buses, light and heavy trucks, and tractors.

This contains a set of fuses, fuses are used to protect the wiring and electrical equipment for vehicles. They are generally rated for circuits no higher than 32 volts direct current, but some types are rated for 42-volt electrical systems.
Power windows or electric windows are automobile windows which can be raised and lowered by pressing a button or switch.
A power side-view mirror is equipped with electrical means for vertical and horizontal adjustment from the inside of the automobile.
A brake is a mechanical device that inhibits motion by absorbing energy from a moving system. It is used for slowing or stopping a moving vehicle, the brake pedal is used to apply brakes.

The throttle, which controls fuel and air supply to the engine is normally the right-most floor pedal. It has a fail-safe design – a spring, which returns it to the idle position when not depressed by the driver.

A gear stick is a metal lever attached to the shift assembly in a manual transmission-equipped automobile and is used to change gears. The gear stick shown in the image is one that belongs to an automatic transmission.
Gauge clusters refer to the collection of driving instruments behind the steering wheel, including but not limited to the speedometer, tachometer and fuel gauge.

Infotainment systems are a collection of hardware and software in automobiles that provides audio or video entertainment. In car entertainment originated with car audio systems that consisted of radios and cassette or CD players, and now includes automotive navigation systems, video players, USB and Bluetooth connectivity, Carputers, in-car internet, and WiFi. The one shown in the image provided represents the basic representation of an infotainment system consisting of a radio and a CD player.
Automobile air conditioning, also referred tp as A/C, are systems that are used to cool the air in a vehicle.

In road vehicles, the parking brake, also known as a hand brake or emergency brake (e-brake), is a mechanism used to keep the vehicle securely motionless when parked. It is also used to help perform an emergency stop should the main hydraulic brakes fail.

A glove compartment or glovebox is a compartment built into the dashboard of an automobile, located over the front-seat passenger footwell, and often used for miscellaneous storage. The name derives from the original purpose of the compartment, to store driving gloves.
Radiator cap is removed to add water to the radiator. The purpose of the radiator is to make sure that the cars engine does not heat up unnecessarily.
The windscreen washer reservoir contains fluids that are sprayed on to the windscreen to keep it clean.
The oil dipstick is used to check the level of engine oil in the engine.

An engine or motor is a machine designed to convert one form of energy into mechanical energy. Heat engines, like the internal combustion engine, burn a fuel to create heat which is then used to do work.

The engine oil cap is to be removed to be able to add oil to the engine of the car. Motor oil is used for lubrication of internal combustion engines. The main function of motor oil is to reduce friction and wear on moving parts and to clean the engine from sludge.

The break fluid reservoir is used to add break fluid. Brake fluid is a type of hydraulic fluid used in hydraulic brake applications in cars. It is used to transfer force into pressure, and to amplify braking force.
The air filter box contains the air filter which is used to make sure that filtered and clean air goes into the cabin of the car.
An automotive battery is a rechargeable battery that supplies electrical current to a motor vehicle. Its main purpose is to feed the starter, which starts the engine.

Can you see steam coming out of radiator?
